title: The Sphinx (British Columbia)
text:
The Sphinx is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in the southernmost <a href="Coast%20Mountains">Coast Mountains</a> of <a href="British%20Columbia">British Columbia</a>, <a href="Canada">Canada</a>. It is south-east of <a href="Garibaldi%20Lake">Garibaldi Lake</a>.
Climate.
Based on the <a href="K%C3%B6ppen%20climate%20classification">Köppen climate classification</a>, The Sphinx is located in a <a href="marine%20west%20coast">marine west coast</a> climate zone of western <a href="North%20America">North America</a>. Most <a href="weather%20front">weather front</a>s originate in the <a href="Pacific%20Ocean">Pacific Ocean</a>, and travel east toward the Coast Mountains where they are forced upward by the range (<a href="Orographic%20lift">Orographic lift</a>), causing them to drop their moisture in the form of rain or snowfall. As a result, the Coast Mountains experience high precipitation, especially during the winter months in the form of snowfall. Temperatures can drop below −20 °C with wind chill factors below −30 °C.
